Parameters: Class: The class of the derived TestCase implementation.
scrubClass(java.lang.Class<?>).Description: This function is called by various TestCase implementations, at tearDown() time, in order to scrub out any class variables. This protects against memory leaks in the case where a test case creates a non-static inner class (thus referencing the test case) and gives it to someone else to hold onto.
scrubClass(java.lang.Class<?>).history: Added in API level 1 Deprecated in API level 24

getActivity().history: Added in API level 1 Deprecated in API level 24

setActivity(android.app.Activity).history: Added in API level 1 Deprecated in API level 24

ClassDesc: New tests should be written using the This is common code used to support Activity test cases. For more useful classes, please see @B_android#test#ActivityUnitTestCase_E@ and @B_android#test#ActivityInstrumentationTestCase_E@.
